content: I was curious if we have the ability to update styling at all. My idea is to fix how links are scrolled to, particularly in the glossary where the entire item can be hidden behind the header. I was thinking something simple like this: https://stackoverflow.com/a/13117744/1483396 but curious if that's something we have access to in markdown (in the worst case, in-page styling could be an optioin, but would be terrible for maintainability).
I started a new job recently, so my time is very limited. I could probably start after work (US EST) if everyone's up for the idea
@Paul Faria It's a good question. I definitely find that annoying too...
I think mdbook has some sort of styling feature, but I have never attempted to see what it is capable of
On the other hand, this seems to me more like a bug that should be fixed by mdbook: the header should push the content down rather than hovering over it.
I would personally prefer to fix it in mdbook rather than hack around it in rustc-dev-guide... if it's not too much work, anyway
I have a small functioning prototype here. I think this can be done without affecting too much. I might be doable within even book.css rather than on any pages: http://jsfiddle.net/j153ndt2/5/
I'll follow back up on this tomorrow morning if I have time. If not then tomorrow evening or late Saturday.
Latest iteration from this morning. Going to continue after work: http://jsfiddle.net/s13b8pwu/1/

Bit of a delay, surprisingly busy weekend considering I was stuck at home.
